Subject: "Add URIs" functionality in View/Edit Frontier screen
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=234926651; y=Yuu303XjRPez9x6jcdj5HT51HNeN1Z4ap60dvacSkT-YBw

In Heritrix 1.9, after a crawl job has been paused, the user can click 
"View or Edit Frontier URIs" and be taken to a screen where they can 
add, view, or delete URIs.  Am I right in assuming the Add URIs section 
  allows users to add URIs directly to the frontier?  What advantage 
would there be to doing this instead of adding the URIs as additional seeds?

In the Add URIs section, there's a text box that is labeled "Import from 
file:".  I created a text file and specified the path to the file 
(C:\temp\urls.txt), but when I clicked on "Import URIs", it generated an 
error:

Failed to get inputstream from C:\temp\urls.txt

and a SEVERE alert.  Is there something else that I should be typing in 
this box?  There's no Browse button, so that makes me think that it 
really isn't expecting an actual file path here.  There's also no "?" 
link which would tell the field is for.

I tried looking for some info about the Add URIs section in the User 
Manual but couldn't find anything.

Thanks,
Frank
